description:
LATEST: Course Fully Updated For November 2015

You know that people in India dress differently and use more languages than people in Canada, but are appearance and speech really the only differences between two cultures? Before immersing yourself in a new environment, it is best to do research beforehand about what you might encounter so that you can feel more comfortable in your new surroundings, blend in with the local crowd, and avoid embarrassing social situations through innocent offenses. What considerations should you give to your behavior or mannerisms? Your clothing? Your speech?

This course will walk you through topics related to cultural issues that you should research and reflect upon before departure, including local customs (e.g. etiquette, tipping, bargaining) and local laws (e.g. alcohol consumption, decency).

In addition, this course will address and provide coping methods for the feelings of "culture shock" that many travelers experience when going abroad for the first time. Finally, the course will wrap up by addressing ways to deal with "reverse culture shock," the frustration many travelers feel when returning home from an incredible international experience.

No prior travel knowledge is required!

+++++++++++++++++++++++

What You Get:

  • A comprehensive travel checklist which details everything you need to do before you depart for your international trip. (PDF)
  • 24/7 lifetime access to course content and materials.
  • All future extra lectures and upgrades are always included for free.
  • Unconditional Udemy 30 day money-back guarantee.

You'll Learn:

  1. 3 important reasons to prepare culturally for an international trip
  2. How to understand and recognize culture shock
  3. What local laws you should research in your destination country before arrival
  4. What local customs you should research in your destination country before arrival
  5. Travel tips for overcoming cultural differences with new friends you will meet
  6. How to identify and cope with reverse culture shock upon return home

Click the "take this course" button, top right, now ... and learn how to become a savvy world traveler who can prevent and handle health issues abroad today!

Bailey Richert, Author, Entrepreneur and World Traveler / Founder, Don't Die Abroad
title: Cultural Issues Encountered by International Travelers
